text:
Bottle:
Clear gold with a short white head.
Barley, a little citrus in the aroma.
Sweet barley malt, a touch of lemon flavour.
A bit of pils and slightly spicy hopping at the finish....
An excellent and really enjoyable example of the style.

Hay, thyme nose. Hazy amber, medium head, nice lace. Grassy hay, thyme, basil. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Schlafly continues to suprise with these lagers. Nice hop presence, pilsnery. Flavorful, very drinkable.

Pours a light straw color. About three fingers eggshell colored head . Reduces to about one finger head. Good lacing. Pretty good retention.Aroma is pilsneresque. Floral and earthy hops. Light coriander, light pepper. Light yeast. Cracker.Taste is malty, but not too sweet. Reminds me of Red Stripe. Light lemon, light alcohol. Crackery. Some herbal hops add some bitterness, or is it the alcohol?Mouthfeel is medium bodied. Quite dry. Finishes a little harsh and awkward. A little oily and hoo bitter, I think.Overall, its drinkable. Not sure where theyre going with this. Nah, I wouldnt recommend this, and I wouldnt buy it again. Its as good enough to swallow, but nothing more.
Yellow straw pour. Light grassy hops up front and in the aftertaste. Sweet grain backbone. Pleasant and crisp.

12 ounce bottle from the brewery. Hazy gold, large foamy white head, good retention. Aroma of Noble, herbal, floral hops, pale malt. The taste is Noble, grassy hops, doughy pale malt. Medium bodied, crisp.
12 ounce bottle. Clean looking pour. Floral notes with some hop characteristics. Pretty nice.
UPDATED: NOV 22, 2016 Bottle into a pint glass. Aroma is largely floral hops. Tastes crisp and smooth.

12 oz. bottle via trade. Pours a just barely cloudy bright gold with a small white head that settles into a ring, as well as a few small islands of films and stray ropes of lace. Big pils malts, bready and crackery and a little biscuity, with straw, grassy Noble hops, with a bit of floral bitterness and some grainy dustiness. Light-plus bodied, with moderate carbonation and a malty, smooth, slightly sweet and bitter mouthfeel. Really nice, pleasant beer. Nice new annual offering from Schlafly.

I had this at Buffalo Wild Wings. Pours gold with a white head. Taste grain, mildly sweet, crisp. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Pours a clear golden color with a decent head. Aroma of citrus, grain, and bit of malt. Taste of citrus, light malt sweetness and grain. Nice bitterness and a clean finish. Light body, crisp clean and refreshing. Enjoyable beer.

12 oz. bottle from Liquor Barn (Jefferson Commons); bottled on 9/8/16. Aroma: Herbal lemon loaf; really has a malt character reminiscent of a Helles, but the hops are more in line with a German Pils. Appearance: Transparent yellow gold body with healthy carbonation holding up a foamy white head that settles into a patchy skin. Flavor: More herbal up front with bready malts coming in more midway through; lemony hop notes become more prevalent at the same time, and lead to a lightly bitter/off dry finish. Palate: Medium body, sticky texture, average carbonation, bitter finish. Overall: Im a fan. Has all the features youd expect from a clean, characterful German interpretation of the style.
355ml bottle. Hazed godl pour. This stuff seems really fresh and its nice. Bit of a lagery aroma but the flavor is crisp with a honey cracker flavor and subtle herbal hops. Good stuff.

A very good lager. Pour is hazy and straw color with a medium white head that sticks to glass. Aroma is clean and just a touch of hops present. The thing that stands out most for me with this beer is the creaminess most lagers are just water down and this has great mouth feel.

Pour is a hazy golden with a large white head. Aroma is some sweet grassy malt with a decent hop perfume. Flavor is more of a neutral grain with a surprising amount of bitterness. Finish is clean and refreshing. A little bit sweeter than I like but this was a flavorful hoppy lager.

On draft at ITAP CoMo. Golen and clear. Some off white soapy foam leaves heavy lacing. A grainy beginning. Floral and gentle fruit flavors and fragrances. Very gentle earth. Gentle is a good description for this. A hint of tropical varietied fruit. Something like Juicy Fruit gum and light tartness. Tasty and pleasant.
Aroma is pale/earthy malts and beery. The flavor is fruit, pale malts and a beery/slightly spicy German hop finish.

Hazy, gold pour with a frothy white head. The aroma has grassy hops along with some light mildew. It has a light, oily body with average carbonation. The taste is mildly bitter with an easy finish.dough,

Bottle - fair size foamy head, clear light gold color, moderately sweet light malt/almost corn like aroma and flavor, well balanced though with some earthy hops, smooth finish, good overall for what it is 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It pours clear golden with a white head. The aroma has grassy hops, spice, rounded lager and caramel. It has a medium body thats almost oily and has very light carbonation. The taste of light on the hops for noble in the name. Its very crackery, herbal and an odd taste I cant put my finger on.

Bottle. It poured a clear golden color with a white head. The aroma was of light cereal grains and some grass. The taste was similar to the aroma with more grains, grass, malts, with some nice hop bitterness. It was light bodied with nice carbonation. Good stuff.

Pours a clear pale golden with a thick head that looks like whipped egg whites. Aroma is both bready and grassy. Taste is sweet pale malt, crackers, dry grain and mild hop bitterness. Pretty good, but just another craft brewed traditional American lager.
